content: Investments Asked by David MorganAsked on 20 Aug 2019Has anyone used RobinHood?Has anyone tried using RobinHood Stocks Platform? I get the understand of they do not have fees but in return when we execute, they get around 1-2% if Iâ€™m not wrong?4 answersAnswerBump1

He actually has a US based bank account when he was working there and he has been using it ever since.Will get him to reply here on his experience! Look out for it :)1 comment2

DeleteEditHariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomUpdated on 21 Aug 2019I don't think Singaporeans are allowed to use RobinHood if I'm not wrong.1 comment2
Justin Kieran Ong27 Aug 2019You require an US Bank account and/or green card (or equivalent) if I'm not wrong

Tee-Ming Chew, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 21 Aug 2019Robinhood is a commission free stock trading platform and they don't charge any fee when you trade with them. However, the SEC and FINRA do charge a small fee for stock sell orders.If you're wondering what is their business model, they actually earn from Robinhood Gold (their premium subscription) and from the interest on money stored on the Robinhood accounts.Hope that helps!1 comment1
Lam Ka Ying21 Aug 2019Just wondering if you have to pay any taxes (withholding or capital gain) for the trades you make?

Lam Ka YingLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 21 Aug 2019Hi, you will need an SSN to open an account so most likely you will need to have some working experience for foreigners. That said, it is completely free to trade as they charge for other services. You can read up more on their business model online :)0 comments0
